content: I have an HTML page that contains several images. Each image has a different width and height. I want to resize all the images to a specific size. What is the best way to achieve this using CSS? Please provide the CSS code. Data format: You must have [ HTML page ] and [ CSS code ] data types in the following Rewrite prompt Rewrite prompt: I have an HTML page with multiple images, each having a different width and height. I want to resize all the images to a specific size using CSS. Here is the HTML code: What is the best way to resize all images to a specific size, say 250x250, using CSS? Please provide the CSS code.

To resize all the images to a specific size using CSS, you can use the following approach: [ HTML page ] ```html ``` [ CSS code ] ```css img { width: 250px; height: 250px; object-fit: cover; /* This will ensure the images are resized to fill the dimensions while maintaining aspect ratio */ } ``` This CSS code will ensure all images on your HTML page are resized to a uniform width and height of 250x250 pixels. The `object-fit: cover;` property ensures that the images maintain their aspect ratio while covering the specified dimensions.
